intro: Verbesina arnottii, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across open habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures and are often covered in fine hairs. Verbesina arnottii thrives in full sun and is commonly found in meadows, prairies, and along roadsides.
